intro: Hyaloseris longicephala, commonly known as the long-headed hyaloseris, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are often brightly colored. Hyaloseris longicephala is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in forest understories or along stream banks. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
